1→# App Directory - LLM Reference 2→ 3→**GENERATED**: 2025-12-11 4→**SCOPE**: Frontend application root - Configuration, build tools, static assets, entry points 5→**OPTIMIZATION**: Semantic Searchability + Digestibility 6→ 7→--- 8→ 9→## QUICK_STATS 10→ 11→[TOTAL_ROOT_FILES]: 9 12→[TOTAL_SUBDIRECTORIES]: 6 13→[PRIMARY_LANGUAGE]: JavaScript/TypeScript (React 18) 14→[BUILD_TOOL]: Vite 5.0 15→[ARCHITECTURE]: Islands Architecture 16→[DEPLOYMENT]: Cloudflare Pages 17→[KEY_PATTERNS]: Multi-page app, Route Registry, Islands pattern, ESM modules 18→ 19→--- 20→ 21→## ROOT_FILES 22→ 23→### package.json 24→[INTENT]: NPM package configuration and dependency management 25→[TYPE]: ESM module (type: "module") 26→[SCRIPTS]: dev (port 8000), build, preview, generate-routes, prebuild 27→[DEPENDENCIES]: React 18, Supabase client, Google Maps React, date-fns, framer-motion, react-hook-form, zod, styled-components 28→[DEV_DEPENDENCIES]: Vite 5, @vitejs/plugin-react, esbuild, supabase CLI 29→[RUNTIME]: Bun preferred, Node compatible 30→ 31→### vite.config.js 32→[INTENT]: Vite bundler configuration for multi-page React application 33→[PLUGINS]: @vitejs/plugin-react, multi-page-routing middleware, move-html-to-root post-build 34→[ROUTING_LOGIC]: Shared routing function for dev and preview servers using Route Registry 35→[BUILD_INPUT]: 27 HTML entry points from public/ directory 36→[BUILD_OUTPUT]: dist/ with HTML at root, assets in dist/assets/ 37→[DEV_SERVER]: Port 8000, localhost + 127.0.0.1, /api proxy to wrangler (port 8788) 38→[PREVIEW_SERVER]: Port 8000, 127.0.0.1 39→[POST_BUILD_TASKS]: Move HTML to dist root, copy assets/, copy _redirects, copy _headers, copy _routes.json, create _internal/ files, copy images/, copy help-center-articles/, copy functions/ 40→[IMPORTS]: routes, getInternalRoutes, getBasePath, buildRollupInputs from src/routes.config.js 41→ 42→### tsconfig.json 43→[INTENT]: TypeScript compiler configuration for React app 44→[TARGET]: ES2020 45→[MODULE]: ESNext 46→[JSX]: react-jsx 47→[MODE]: Bundler mode resolution 48→[STRICT]: Disabled (strict: false) 49→[INCLUDE]: src directory 50→[ALLOW_JS]: true 51→[NO_EMIT]: true (type checking only, Vite handles compilation) 52→ 53→### tsconfig.node.json 54→[INTENT]: TypeScript configuration for Node.js scripts 55→[COMPOSITE]: true 56→[MODULE]: ESNext 57→[INCLUDE]: vite.config.js 58→ 59→### .env.example 60→[INTENT]: Environment variable template for local development 61→[REQUIRED_VARS]: VITE_SUPABASE_URL, VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, VITE_GOOGLE_MAPS_API_KEY 62→[OPTIONAL_VARS]: SLACK_WEBHOOK_ACQUISITION, SLACK_WEBHOOK_GENERAL 63→[REMOVED_VARS]: VITE_BUBBLE_API_BASE_URL, VITE_BUBBLE_API_KEY (migrated to Edge Functions) 64→[SECURITY_NOTE]: Bubble API keys now stored server-side in Supabase Secrets 65→ 66→### .gitignore 67→[INTENT]: Git ignore patterns 68→[IGNORED]: node_modules/, dist/, .env, .env.local, *.log, .DS_Store, ../input 69→ 70→### bun.lock 71→[INTENT]: Bun package manager lockfile 72→[PURPOSE]: Reproducible dependency installation 73→ 74→### .gitkeep-functions 75→[INTENT]: Placeholder to keep functions directory in git 76→ 77→--- 78→ 79→## SUBDIRECTORIES 80→ 81→### src/ 82→[INTENT]: React application source code 83→[CONTAINS]: Entry points (*.jsx), islands/, lib/, logic/, styles/, routes/, config/, data/ 84→[ARCHITECTURE]: Islands Architecture with hollow components 85→[DOCUMENTATION]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\CLAUDE.md 86→[ENTRY_POINTS]: 27 JSX files that mount React components to HTML pages 87→[KEY_SUBDIRS]: islands/ (React components), lib/ (utilities + API clients), logic/ (4-layer business logic), styles/ (CSS) 88→ 89→### public/ 90→[INTENT]: Static assets and HTML templates for multi-page app 91→[CONTAINS]: HTML files, assets/, images/, help-center-articles/, _redirects, _headers, _routes.json 92→[HTML_FILES]: 27 files (index.html, search.html, view-split-lease.html, etc.) 93→[DEPLOYMENT_FILES]: _redirects (Cloudflare routing), _headers (HTTP headers), _routes.json (Functions control) 94→[GENERATED_FILES]: _redirects and _routes.json are auto-generated by scripts/generate-redirects.js 95→[COPY_BEHAVIOR]: Assets copied to dist/ during build, HTML files moved to dist root 96→ 97→### public/assets/ 98→[INTENT]: Static media assets 99→[SUBDIRS]: fonts/, games/, icons/, images/, lotties/, resources/, videos/ 100→[USAGE]: Referenced via /assets/ path in HTML/CSS 101→ 102→### public/images/ 103→[INTENT]: Public image files 104→[CONTAINS]: support-centre-icon.svg 105→[USAGE]: Referenced via /images/ path 106→ 107→### public/help-center-articles/ 108→[INTENT]: Static HTML help articles 109→[USAGE]: Served directly by Cloudflare Pages 110→ 111→### scripts/ 112→[INTENT]: Build and development scripts 113→[FILES]: generate-redirects.js 114→[USAGE]: Executed via npm/bun scripts (prebuild hook) 115→ 116→### functions/ 117→[INTENT]: Cloudflare Pages Functions (API routes) 118→[SUBDIRS]: api/ 119→[FILES]: api/faq-inquiry.js 120→[DEPLOYMENT]: Automatically deployed to /api/* routes on Cloudflare Pages 121→[NOTE]: Most backend logic now uses Supabase Edge Functions, not Cloudflare Functions 122→ 123→### functions/api/ 124→[INTENT]: Cloudflare Pages API endpoints 125→[FILES]: faq-inquiry.js, CLAUDE.md 126→[ROUTES]: /api/faq-inquiry 127→[STATUS]: Deprecated in favor of Supabase Edge Functions 128→ 129→### dist/ 130→[INTENT]: Production build output (generated, not in git) 131→[STRUCTURE]: HTML at root, assets/ subdir, _internal/ subdir, functions/ copy 132→[CREATED_BY]: vite build command 133→[DEPLOYMENT_TARGET]: Cloudflare Pages 134→ 135→--- 136→ 137→## ROUTING_SYSTEM 138→ 139→### src/routes.config.js 140→[INTENT]: Single source of truth for all application routes 141→[EXPORTS]: routes array, apiRoutes, excludedFromFunctions, getInternalRoutes(), getBasePath(), matchRoute(), findRouteForUrl(), buildRollupInputs() 142→[ROUTE_COUNT]: 27 routes 143→[ROUTE_TYPES]: Static pages, dynamic routes (:id, :userId, :category), protected routes, dev-only routes 144→[DYNAMIC_ROUTES]: /view-split-lease/:id, /preview-split-lease/:id, /guest-proposals/:userId, /account-profile/:userId, /host-proposals/:userId, /help-center/:category 145→[PROTECTED_ROUTES]: /preview-split-lease, /guest-proposals, /account-profile, /host-proposals, /self-listing, /listing-dashboard, /host-overview, /favorite-listings, /rental-application 146→[CLOUDFLARE_INTERNAL]: Routes using _internal/ directory to avoid 308 redirects 147→[USAGE]: Consumed by vite.config.js, scripts/generate-redirects.js 148→ 149→### scripts/generate-redirects.js 150→[INTENT]: Generate Cloudflare Pages routing files from Route Registry 151→[EXECUTION]: prebuild hook (bun run generate-routes) 152→[GENERATES]: public/_redirects, public/_routes.json 153→[INPUT]: src/routes.config.js 154→[VALIDATION]: Checks for duplicate paths, missing fields, cloudflareInternal consistency 155→[OUTPUT_FORMAT]: _redirects (Cloudflare rewrite syntax), _routes.json (Functions control) 156→ 157→### public/_redirects 158→[INTENT]: Cloudflare Pages routing configuration 159→[GENERATED_BY]: scripts/generate-redirects.js 160→[SYNTAX]: Cloudflare Pages redirects format 161→[PATTERN]: path /_internal/name 200 OR path /file.html 200 162→[DYNAMIC_HANDLING]: Use _internal/ files to prevent Cloudflare's 308 redirects 163→[AUTO_GENERATED]: DO NOT EDIT MANUALLY 164→ 165→### public/_routes.json 166→[INTENT]: Control which routes use Cloudflare Functions 167→[GENERATED_BY]: scripts/generate-redirects.js 168→[INCLUDE]: /api/* (Cloudflare Functions) 169→[EXCLUDE]: /guest-proposals, /guest-proposals/*, /host-proposals, /host-proposals/* 170→[VERSION]: 1 171→ 172→--- 173→ 174→## BUILD_PROCESS 175→ 176→### Development 177→[COMMAND]: bun run dev 178→[PORT]: 8000 179→[SERVER]: Vite dev server with HMR 180→[MIDDLEWARE]: Multi-page routing middleware using Route Registry 181→[PUBLIC_PREFIX]: /public (proxied to public/ directory) 182→[API_PROXY]: /api/* proxied to localhost:8788 (wrangler) 183→ 184→### Production Build 185→[COMMAND]: bun run build 186→[STEPS]: 1) Prebuild (generate routes), 2) Vite build, 3) Post-build (move HTML, copy assets) 187→[OUTPUT]: dist/ directory 188→[HTML_LOCATION]: dist root (e.g., dist/index.html) 189→[ASSETS_LOCATION]: dist/assets/ with hashed filenames 190→[INTERNAL_FILES]: dist/_internal/ (copies of HTML files for Cloudflare routing) 191→[COPIED_DIRS]: assets/, images/, help-center-articles/, functions/ 192→[COPIED_FILES]: _redirects, _headers, _routes.json 193→ 194→### Preview 195→[COMMAND]: bun run preview 196→[PORT]: 8000 197→[SERVER]: Vite preview server (serves dist/) 198→[MIDDLEWARE]: Multi-page routing middleware using Route Registry 199→[PUBLIC_PREFIX]: Empty string (serves from dist root) 200→ 201→--- 202→ 203→## DEPLOYMENT 204→ 205→### Platform 206→[TARGET]: Cloudflare Pages 207→[BUILD_COMMAND]: bun run build 208→[OUTPUT_DIR]: dist 209→[NODE_VERSION]: 18 or higher 210→[FRAMEWORK_PRESET]: None (custom Vite config) 211→ 212→### Routing Strategy 213→[METHOD]: Cloudflare _redirects file + _internal directory 214→[WHY_INTERNAL]: Avoid Cloudflare's "pretty URL" 308 redirects that strip query params/hash 215→[DYNAMIC_ROUTES]: Rewrite to _internal/route-name files 216→[STATIC_ROUTES]: Some use _internal/, some direct to .html 217→ 218→### Functions 219→[CLOUDFLARE_FUNCTIONS]: /api/* (legacy, deprecated) 220→[SUPABASE_EDGE_FUNCTIONS]: Preferred for all backend logic 221→[EXCLUDED_ROUTES]: /guest-proposals/*, /host-proposals/* (no Functions processing) 222→ 223→--- 224→ 225→## ENTRY_POINTS 226→ 227→### HTML Templates (public/*.html) 228→[COUNT]: 27 files 229→[PURPOSE]: Shell pages that load React apps 230→[PATTERN]:
+ 231→[BUILD_BEHAVIOR]: Vite processes, outputs to dist root with hashed asset references 232→ 233→### React Entry Points (src/*.jsx) 234→[COUNT]: 27 files 235→[PATTERN]: Import page component, createRoot, render to #root 236→[EXAMPLES]: main.jsx → HomePage, search.jsx → SearchPage, view-split-lease.jsx → ViewSplitLeasePage 237→ 238→### Entry Point Mapping 239→[HOMEPAGE]: index.html ← src/main.jsx ← HomePage 240→[SEARCH]: search.html ← src/search.jsx ← SearchPage 241→[LISTING_VIEW]: view-split-lease.html ← src/view-split-lease.jsx ← ViewSplitLeasePage 242→[LISTING_PREVIEW]: preview-split-lease.html ← src/preview-split-lease.jsx ← PreviewSplitLeasePage 243→[GUEST_PROPOSALS]: guest-proposals.html ← src/guest-proposals.jsx ← GuestProposalsPage 244→[HOST_PROPOSALS]: host-proposals.html ← src/host-proposals.jsx ← HostProposalsPage 245→[SELF_LISTING]: self-listing.html ← src/self-listing.jsx ← SelfListingPage 246→[SELF_LISTING_V2]: self-listing-v2.html ← src/self-listing-v2.jsx ← SelfListingPageV2 247→[LISTING_DASHBOARD]: listing-dashboard.html ← src/listing-dashboard.jsx ← ListingDashboardPage 248→[HOST_OVERVIEW]: host-overview.html ← src/host-overview.jsx ← HostOverviewPage 249→[ACCOUNT_PROFILE]: account-profile.html ← src/account-profile.jsx ← AccountProfilePage 250→[FAQ]: faq.html ← src/faq.jsx ← FAQPage 251→[HELP_CENTER]: help-center.html ← src/help-center.jsx ← HelpCenterPage 252→[HELP_CATEGORY]: help-center-category.html ← src/help-center-category.jsx ← HelpCenterCategoryPage 253→[POLICIES]: policies.html ← src/policies.jsx ← PoliciesPage 254→[CAREERS]: careers.html ← src/careers.jsx ← CareersPage 255→[ABOUT_US]: about-us.html ← src/about-us.jsx ← AboutUsPage 256→[LIST_WITH_US]: list-with-us.html ← src/list-with-us.jsx ← ListWithUsPage 257→[WHY_SPLIT_LEASE]: why-split-lease.html ← src/why-split-lease.jsx ← WhySplitLeasePage 258→[GUEST_SUCCESS]: guest-success.html ← src/guest-success.jsx ← GuestSuccessPage 259→[HOST_SUCCESS]: host-success.html ← src/host-success.jsx ← HostSuccessPage 260→[FAVORITE_LISTINGS]: favorite-listings.html ← src/favorite-listings.jsx ← FavoriteListingsPage 261→[RENTAL_APPLICATION]: rental-application.html ← src/rental-application.jsx ← RentalApplicationPage 262→[RESET_PASSWORD]: reset-password.html ← src/reset-password.jsx ← ResetPasswordPage 263→[NOT_FOUND]: 404.html ← src/404.jsx ← NotFoundPage 264→[SEARCH_TEST]: search-test.html ← src/search-test.jsx ← SearchPageTest 265→[INTERNAL_TEST]: _internal-test.html ← src/_internal-test.jsx ← InternalTestPage 266→ 267→--- 268→ 269→## ARCHITECTURE_PATTERNS 270→ 271→### Islands Architecture 272→[DESCRIPTION]: Each HTML page is an independent React root 273→[BENEFIT]: No shared state between pages, simpler mental model 274→[NAVIGATION]: Full page loads (no client-side routing) 275→[STATE_PERSISTENCE]: URL params, localStorage, Supabase database 276→ 277→### Route Registry Pattern 278→[DESCRIPTION]: Single source of truth for all routes in src/routes.config.js 279→[CONSUMERS]: Vite dev server, Vite preview, Cloudflare _redirects, Vite build inputs 280→[BENEFIT]: Change route once, updates everywhere 281→[VALIDATION]: Automated checks in generate-redirects.js 282→ 283→### Cloudflare _internal Pattern 284→[DESCRIPTION]: Copy HTML files to dist/_internal/ with custom names 285→[WHY]: Avoid Cloudflare's automatic 308 redirects that strip query params/hash 286→[USAGE]: Dynamic routes and pages needing query/hash preservation 287→[EXAMPLE]: /search → /_internal/search-view 288→ 289→### Hollow Component Pattern 290→[DESCRIPTION]: Page components delegate all logic to custom hooks 291→[BENEFIT]: Testable business logic, focused UI components 292→[LOCATION]: src/islands/pages/ 293→[EXAMPLE]: ViewSplitLeasePage.jsx (UI only) + useViewSplitLeasePageLogic.js (logic) 294→ 295→### Four-Layer Logic Architecture 296→[DESCRIPTION]: Business logic separated into calculators, rules, processors, workflows 297→[LOCATION]: src/logic/ 298→[LAYER_1]: Calculators (pure math functions: calculate*, get*) 299→[LAYER_2]: Rules (boolean predicates: can*, is*, has*, should*) 300→[LAYER_3]: Processors (data transformation: adapt*, extract*, process*, format*) 301→[LAYER_4]: Workflows (orchestration: *Workflow) 302→[BENEFIT]: Reusable, testable, maintainable business logic 303→ 304→--- 305→ 306→## ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES 307→ 308→### Frontend (VITE_ prefix) 309→[VITE_SUPABASE_URL]: Supabase project URL (from Supabase dashboard) 310→[VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY]: Supabase anonymous key (public, safe for client) 311→[VITE_GOOGLE_MAPS_API_KEY]: Google Maps JavaScript API key 312→ 313→### Backend (Supabase Secrets) 314→[BUBBLE_API_BASE_URL]: Bubble.io API endpoint (legacy backend) 315→[BUBBLE_API_KEY]: Bubble.io API authentication 316→[OPENAI_API_KEY]: OpenAI API for AI features 317→[SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY]: Supabase admin key (server-side only) 318→ 319→### Configuration Location 320→[FRONTEND_ENV]: app/.env (local), Cloudflare Pages settings (production) 321→[BACKEND_SECRETS]: Supabase Dashboard → Project Settings → Edge Functions Secrets 322→[SECURITY]: Never expose Bubble/OpenAI keys in frontend code 323→ 324→--- 325→ 326→## CRITICAL_CONVENTIONS 327→ 328→### Day Indexing 329→[JS_FORMAT]: 0-6 (Sunday=0, Monday=1, ..., Saturday=6) 330→[BUBBLE_FORMAT]: 1-7 (Sunday=1, Monday=2, ..., Saturday=7) 331→[CONVERSION_FUNCTIONS]: adaptDaysFromBubble(), adaptDaysToBubble() 332→[LOCATION]: src/logic/processors/external/ 333→[RULE]: Always convert at API boundaries, never mix formats 334→ 335→### Unique ID Generation 336→[METHOD]: Supabase RPC function generate_bubble_id 337→[USAGE]: const { data: newId } = await supabaseAdmin.rpc('generate_bubble_id') 338→[FORMAT]: 17-character alphanumeric string (Bubble-compatible) 339→ 340→### API Architecture 341→[FRONTEND_TO_BACKEND]: Frontend → Supabase Edge Functions → Bubble API 342→[DIRECT_SUPABASE]: Frontend → Supabase Database (for Supabase-native tables) 343→[NEVER]: Frontend → Bubble API directly (security violation) 344→ 345→--- 346→ 347→## DO_RULES 348→ # App Directory - LLM Reference **GENERATED**: 2025-12-11 **SCOPE**: Frontend application root - Configuration, build tools, static assets, entry points **OPTIMIZATION**: Semantic Searchability + Digestibility --- ## QUICK_STATS [TOTAL_ROOT_FILES]: 9 [TOTAL_SUBDIRECTORIES]: 6 [PRIMARY_LANGUAGE]: JavaScript/TypeScript (React 18) [BUILD_TOOL]: Vite 5.0 [ARCHITECTURE]: Islands Architecture [DEPLOYMENT]: Cloudflare Pages [KEY_PATTERNS]: Multi-page app, Route Registry, Islands pattern, ESM modules --- ## ROOT_FILES ### package.json [INTENT]: NPM package configuration and dependency management [TYPE]: ESM module (type: "module") [SCRIPTS]: dev (port 8000), build, preview, generate-routes, prebuild [DEPENDENCIES]: React 18, Supabase client, Google Maps React, date-fns, framer-motion, react-hook-form, zod, styled-components [DEV_DEPENDENCIES]: Vite 5, @vitejs/plugin-react, esbuild, supabase CLI [RUNTIME]: Bun preferred, Node compatible ### vite.config.js [INTENT]: Vite bundler configuration for multi-page React application [PLUGINS]: @vitejs/plugin-react, multi-page-routing middleware, move-html-to-root post-build [ROUTING_LOGIC]: Shared routing function for dev and preview servers using Route Registry [BUILD_INPUT]: 27 HTML entry points from public/ directory [BUILD_OUTPUT]: dist/ with HTML at root, assets in dist/assets/ [DEV_SERVER]: Port 8000, localhost + 127.0.0.1, /api proxy to wrangler (port 8788) [PREVIEW_SERVER]: Port 8000, 127.0.0.1 [POST_BUILD_TASKS]: Move HTML to dist root, copy assets/, copy _redirects, copy _headers, copy _routes.json, create _internal/ files, copy images/, copy help-center-articles/, copy functions/ [IMPORTS]: routes, getInternalRoutes, getBasePath, buildRollupInputs from src/routes.config.js ### tsconfig.json [INTENT]: TypeScript compiler configuration for React app [TARGET]: ES2020 [MODULE]: ESNext [JSX]: react-jsx [MODE]: Bundler mode resolution [STRICT]: Disabled (strict: false) [INCLUDE]: src directory [ALLOW_JS]: true [NO_EMIT]: true (type checking only, Vite handles compilation) ### tsconfig.node.json [INTENT]: TypeScript configuration for Node.js scripts [COMPOSITE]: true [MODULE]: ESNext [INCLUDE]: vite.config.js ### .env.example [INTENT]: Environment variable template for local development [REQUIRED_VARS]: VITE_SUPABASE_URL, VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, VITE_GOOGLE_MAPS_API_KEY [OPTIONAL_VARS]: SLACK_WEBHOOK_ACQUISITION, SLACK_WEBHOOK_GENERAL [REMOVED_VARS]: VITE_BUBBLE_API_BASE_URL, VITE_BUBBLE_API_KEY (migrated to Edge Functions) [SECURITY_NOTE]: Bubble API keys now stored server-side in Supabase Secrets ### .gitignore [INTENT]: Git ignore patterns [IGNORED]: node_modules/, dist/, .env, .env.local, *.log, .DS_Store, ../input ### bun.lock [INTENT]: Bun package manager lockfile [PURPOSE]: Reproducible dependency installation ### .gitkeep-functions [INTENT]: Placeholder to keep functions directory in git --- ## SUBDIRECTORIES ### src/ [INTENT]: React application source code [CONTAINS]: Entry points (*.jsx), islands/, lib/, logic/, styles/, routes/, config/, data/ [ARCHITECTURE]: Islands Architecture with hollow components [DOCUMENTATION]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\CLAUDE.md [ENTRY_POINTS]: 27 JSX files that mount React components to HTML pages [KEY_SUBDIRS]: islands/ (React components), lib/ (utilities + API clients), logic/ (4-layer business logic), styles/ (CSS) ### public/ [INTENT]: Static assets and HTML templates for multi-page app [CONTAINS]: HTML files, assets/, images/, help-center-articles/, _redirects, _headers, _routes.json [HTML_FILES]: 27 files (index.html, search.html, view-split-lease.html, etc.) [DEPLOYMENT_FILES]: _redirects (Cloudflare routing), _headers (HTTP headers), _routes.json (Functions control) [GENERATED_FILES]: _redirects and _routes.json are auto-generated by scripts/generate-redirects.js [COPY_BEHAVIOR]: Assets copied to dist/ during build, HTML files moved to dist root ### public/assets/ [INTENT]: Static media assets [SUBDIRS]: fonts/, games/, icons/, images/, lotties/, resources/, videos/ [USAGE]: Referenced via /assets/ path in HTML/CSS ### public/images/ [INTENT]: Public image files [CONTAINS]: support-centre-icon.svg [USAGE]: Referenced via /images/ path ### public/help-center-articles/ [INTENT]: Static HTML help articles [USAGE]: Served directly by Cloudflare Pages ### scripts/ [INTENT]: Build and development scripts [FILES]: generate-redirects.js [USAGE]: Executed via npm/bun scripts (prebuild hook) ### functions/ [INTENT]: Cloudflare Pages Functions (API routes) [SUBDIRS]: api/ [FILES]: api/faq-inquiry.js [DEPLOYMENT]: Automatically deployed to /api/* routes on Cloudflare Pages [NOTE]: Most backend logic now uses Supabase Edge Functions, not Cloudflare Functions ### functions/api/ [INTENT]: Cloudflare Pages API endpoints [FILES]: faq-inquiry.js, CLAUDE.md [ROUTES]: /api/faq-inquiry [STATUS]: Deprecated in favor of Supabase Edge Functions ### dist/ [INTENT]: Production build output (generated, not in git) [STRUCTURE]: HTML at root, assets/ subdir, _internal/ subdir, functions/ copy [CREATED_BY]: vite build command [DEPLOYMENT_TARGET]: Cloudflare Pages --- ## ROUTING_SYSTEM ### src/routes.config.js [INTENT]: Single source of truth for all application routes [EXPORTS]: routes array, apiRoutes, excludedFromFunctions, getInternalRoutes(), getBasePath(), matchRoute(), findRouteForUrl(), buildRollupInputs() [ROUTE_COUNT]: 27 routes [ROUTE_TYPES]: Static pages, dynamic routes (:id, :userId, :category), protected routes, dev-only routes [DYNAMIC_ROUTES]: /view-split-lease/:id, /preview-split-lease/:id, /guest-proposals/:userId, /account-profile/:userId, /host-proposals/:userId, /help-center/:category [PROTECTED_ROUTES]: /preview-split-lease, /guest-proposals, /account-profile, /host-proposals, /self-listing, /listing-dashboard, /host-overview, /favorite-listings, /rental-application [CLOUDFLARE_INTERNAL]: Routes using _internal/ directory to avoid 308 redirects [USAGE]: Consumed by vite.config.js, scripts/generate-redirects.js ### scripts/generate-redirects.js [INTENT]: Generate Cloudflare Pages routing files from Route Registry [EXECUTION]: prebuild hook (bun run generate-routes) [GENERATES]: public/_redirects, public/_routes.json [INPUT]: src/routes.config.js [VALIDATION]: Checks for duplicate paths, missing fields, cloudflareInternal consistency [OUTPUT_FORMAT]: _redirects (Cloudflare rewrite syntax), _routes.json (Functions control) ### public/_redirects [INTENT]: Cloudflare Pages routing configuration [GENERATED_BY]: scripts/generate-redirects.js [SYNTAX]: Cloudflare Pages redirects format [PATTERN]: path /_internal/name 200 OR path /file.html 200 [DYNAMIC_HANDLING]: Use _internal/ files to prevent Cloudflare's 308 redirects [AUTO_GENERATED]: DO NOT EDIT MANUALLY ### public/_routes.json [INTENT]: Control which routes use Cloudflare Functions [GENERATED_BY]: scripts/generate-redirects.js [INCLUDE]: /api/* (Cloudflare Functions) [EXCLUDE]: /guest-proposals, /guest-proposals/*, /host-proposals, /host-proposals/* [VERSION]: 1 --- ## BUILD_PROCESS ### Development [COMMAND]: bun run dev [PORT]: 8000 [SERVER]: Vite dev server with HMR [MIDDLEWARE]: Multi-page routing middleware using Route Registry [PUBLIC_PREFIX]: /public (proxied to public/ directory) [API_PROXY]: /api/* proxied to localhost:8788 (wrangler) ### Production Build [COMMAND]: bun run build [STEPS]: 1) Prebuild (generate routes), 2) Vite build, 3) Post-build (move HTML, copy assets) [OUTPUT]: dist/ directory [HTML_LOCATION]: dist root (e.g., dist/index.html) [ASSETS_LOCATION]: dist/assets/ with hashed filenames [INTERNAL_FILES]: dist/_internal/ (copies of HTML files for Cloudflare routing) [COPIED_DIRS]: assets/, images/, help-center-articles/, functions/ [COPIED_FILES]: _redirects, _headers, _routes.json ### Preview [COMMAND]: bun run preview [PORT]: 8000 [SERVER]: Vite preview server (serves dist/) [MIDDLEWARE]: Multi-page routing middleware using Route Registry [PUBLIC_PREFIX]: Empty string (serves from dist root) --- ## DEPLOYMENT ### Platform [TARGET]: Cloudflare Pages [BUILD_COMMAND]: bun run build [OUTPUT_DIR]: dist [NODE_VERSION]: 18 or higher [FRAMEWORK_PRESET]: None (custom Vite config) ### Routing Strategy [METHOD]: Cloudflare _redirects file + _internal directory [WHY_INTERNAL]: Avoid Cloudflare's "pretty URL" 308 redirects that strip query params/hash [DYNAMIC_ROUTES]: Rewrite to _internal/route-name files [STATIC_ROUTES]: Some use _internal/, some direct to .html ### Functions [CLOUDFLARE_FUNCTIONS]: /api/* (legacy, deprecated) [SUPABASE_EDGE_FUNCTIONS]: Preferred for all backend logic [EXCLUDED_ROUTES]: /guest-proposals/*, /host-proposals/* (no Functions processing) --- ## ENTRY_POINTS ### HTML Templates (public/*.html) [COUNT]: 27 files [PURPOSE]: Shell pages that load React apps [PATTERN]:
+ [BUILD_BEHAVIOR]: Vite processes, outputs to dist root with hashed asset references ### React Entry Points (src/*.jsx) [COUNT]: 27 files [PATTERN]: Import page component, createRoot, render to #root [EXAMPLES]: main.jsx → HomePage, search.jsx → SearchPage, view-split-lease.jsx → ViewSplitLeasePage ### Entry Point Mapping [HOMEPAGE]: index.html ← src/main.jsx ← HomePage [SEARCH]: search.html ← src/search.jsx ← SearchPage [LISTING_VIEW]: view-split-lease.html ← src/view-split-lease.jsx ← ViewSplitLeasePage [LISTING_PREVIEW]: preview-split-lease.html ← src/preview-split-lease.jsx ← PreviewSplitLeasePage [GUEST_PROPOSALS]: guest-proposals.html ← src/guest-proposals.jsx ← GuestProposalsPage [HOST_PROPOSALS]: host-proposals.html ← src/host-proposals.jsx ← HostProposalsPage [SELF_LISTING]: self-listing.html ← src/self-listing.jsx ← SelfListingPage [SELF_LISTING_V2]: self-listing-v2.html ← src/self-listing-v2.jsx ← SelfListingPageV2 [LISTING_DASHBOARD]: listing-dashboard.html ← src/listing-dashboard.jsx ← ListingDashboardPage [HOST_OVERVIEW]: host-overview.html ← src/host-overview.jsx ← HostOverviewPage [ACCOUNT_PROFILE]: account-profile.html ← src/account-profile.jsx ← AccountProfilePage [FAQ]: faq.html ← src/faq.jsx ← FAQPage [HELP_CENTER]: help-center.html ← src/help-center.jsx ← HelpCenterPage [HELP_CATEGORY]: help-center-category.html ← src/help-center-category.jsx ← HelpCenterCategoryPage [POLICIES]: policies.html ← src/policies.jsx ← PoliciesPage [CAREERS]: careers.html ← src/careers.jsx ← CareersPage [ABOUT_US]: about-us.html ← src/about-us.jsx ← AboutUsPage [LIST_WITH_US]: list-with-us.html ← src/list-with-us.jsx ← ListWithUsPage [WHY_SPLIT_LEASE]: why-split-lease.html ← src/why-split-lease.jsx ← WhySplitLeasePage [GUEST_SUCCESS]: guest-success.html ← src/guest-success.jsx ← GuestSuccessPage [HOST_SUCCESS]: host-success.html ← src/host-success.jsx ← HostSuccessPage [FAVORITE_LISTINGS]: favorite-listings.html ← src/favorite-listings.jsx ← FavoriteListingsPage [RENTAL_APPLICATION]: rental-application.html ← src/rental-application.jsx ← RentalApplicationPage [RESET_PASSWORD]: reset-password.html ← src/reset-password.jsx ← ResetPasswordPage [NOT_FOUND]: 404.html ← src/404.jsx ← NotFoundPage [SEARCH_TEST]: search-test.html ← src/search-test.jsx ← SearchPageTest [INTERNAL_TEST]: _internal-test.html ← src/_internal-test.jsx ← InternalTestPage --- ## ARCHITECTURE_PATTERNS ### Islands Architecture [DESCRIPTION]: Each HTML page is an independent React root [BENEFIT]: No shared state between pages, simpler mental model [NAVIGATION]: Full page loads (no client-side routing) [STATE_PERSISTENCE]: URL params, localStorage, Supabase database ### Route Registry Pattern [DESCRIPTION]: Single source of truth for all routes in src/routes.config.js [CONSUMERS]: Vite dev server, Vite preview, Cloudflare _redirects, Vite build inputs [BENEFIT]: Change route once, updates everywhere [VALIDATION]: Automated checks in generate-redirects.js ### Cloudflare _internal Pattern [DESCRIPTION]: Copy HTML files to dist/_internal/ with custom names [WHY]: Avoid Cloudflare's automatic 308 redirects that strip query params/hash [USAGE]: Dynamic routes and pages needing query/hash preservation [EXAMPLE]: /search → /_internal/search-view ### Hollow Component Pattern [DESCRIPTION]: Page components delegate all logic to custom hooks [BENEFIT]: Testable business logic, focused UI components [LOCATION]: src/islands/pages/ [EXAMPLE]: ViewSplitLeasePage.jsx (UI only) + useViewSplitLeasePageLogic.js (logic) ### Four-Layer Logic Architecture [DESCRIPTION]: Business logic separated into calculators, rules, processors, workflows [LOCATION]: src/logic/ [LAYER_1]: Calculators (pure math functions: calculate*, get*) [LAYER_2]: Rules (boolean predicates: can*, is*, has*, should*) [LAYER_3]: Processors (data transformation: adapt*, extract*, process*, format*) [LAYER_4]: Workflows (orchestration: *Workflow) [BENEFIT]: Reusable, testable, maintainable business logic --- ## ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES ### Frontend (VITE_ prefix) [VITE_SUPABASE_URL]: Supabase project URL (from Supabase dashboard) [VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY]: Supabase anonymous key (public, safe for client) [VITE_GOOGLE_MAPS_API_KEY]: Google Maps JavaScript API key ### Backend (Supabase Secrets) [BUBBLE_API_BASE_URL]: Bubble.io API endpoint (legacy backend) [BUBBLE_API_KEY]: Bubble.io API authentication [OPENAI_API_KEY]: OpenAI API for AI features [SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY]: Supabase admin key (server-side only) ### Configuration Location [FRONTEND_ENV]: app/.env (local), Cloudflare Pages settings (production) [BACKEND_SECRETS]: Supabase Dashboard → Project Settings → Edge Functions Secrets [SECURITY]: Never expose Bubble/OpenAI keys in frontend code --- ## CRITICAL_CONVENTIONS ### Day Indexing [JS_FORMAT]: 0-6 (Sunday=0, Monday=1, ..., Saturday=6) [BUBBLE_FORMAT]: 1-7 (Sunday=1, Monday=2, ..., Saturday=7) [CONVERSION_FUNCTIONS]: adaptDaysFromBubble(), adaptDaysToBubble() [LOCATION]: src/logic/processors/external/ [RULE]: Always convert at API boundaries, never mix formats ### Unique ID Generation [METHOD]: Supabase RPC function generate_bubble_id [USAGE]: const { data: newId } = await supabaseAdmin.rpc('generate_bubble_id') [FORMAT]: 17-character alphanumeric string (Bubble-compatible) ### API Architecture [FRONTEND_TO_BACKEND]: Frontend → Supabase Edge Functions → Bubble API [DIRECT_SUPABASE]: Frontend → Supabase Database (for Supabase-native tables) [NEVER]: Frontend → Bubble API directly (security violation) --- ## DO_RULES [DO_USE_ROUTE_REGISTRY]: Always update src/routes.config.js for route changes [DO_GENERATE_ROUTES]: Run bun run generate-routes after route config changes [DO_USE_EDGE_FUNCTIONS]: Proxy all Bubble API calls through Supabase Edge Functions [DO_STORE_SECRETS]: Keep API keys in Supabase Secrets, never in frontend [DO_COMMIT_CHANGES]: Git commit after each logical change (per project instructions) [DO_USE_ESM]: Use ES modules (import/export), not CommonJS [DO_USE_BUN]: Prefer bun for package management and script execution [DO_USE_HOLLOW_PATTERN]: Keep page components minimal, delegate logic to hooks [DO_USE_FOUR_LAYERS]: Organize business logic into calculators/rules/processors/workflows [DO_CONVERT_DAYS]: Use adaptDaysFromBubble/adaptDaysToBubble at API boundaries --- ## DONT_RULES [DONT_EDIT_GENERATED]: Never manually edit _redirects or _routes.json (auto-generated) [DONT_EXPOSE_KEYS]: Never put Bubble/OpenAI API keys in frontend code or .env [DONT_SKIP_VALIDATION]: Always run generate-redirects.js validation before deploying [DONT_CALL_BUBBLE_DIRECTLY]: Never call Bubble API from frontend (security risk) [DONT_MIX_DAY_FORMATS]: Never use 0-based and 1-based days in same function [DONT_PUSH_FORCE]: Never git push --force to main/master [DONT_ADD_FALLBACKS]: No fallback mechanisms when encountering errors (per project philosophy) [DONT_OVER_ENGINEER]: Match solution to actual scale, not hypothetical future needs [DONT_MODIFY_DB]: Never modify Supabase tables without explicit instruction --- ## RELATED_DOCUMENTATION [PROJECT_ROOT]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\.claude\CLAUDE.md [SOURCE_CODE]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\CLAUDE.md [SUPABASE]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\supabase\CLAUDE.md [DATABASE_SCHEMA]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\DATABASE_SCHEMA_OVERVIEW.md [ROUTING_GUIDE]: C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\.claude\Documentation\Routing\ROUTING_GUIDE.md

573→``` 574→ 575→### Hollow Component Pattern 576→[DESCRIPTION]: UI component delegates ALL logic to custom hook 577→[COMPONENT]: Contains only JSX rendering 578→[HOOK]: Contains all state, effects, handlers 579→[BENEFIT]: Testable logic, focused rendering, reusable logic 580→ 581→```javascript 582→// islands/pages/ViewSplitLeasePage.jsx 583→export default function ViewSplitLeasePage() { 584→ {/* Pure JSX using logic.* */}
; 586→} 587→ 588→// islands/pages/useViewSplitLeasePageLogic.js 589→export function useViewSplitLeasePageLogic() { 590→ // ALL state, effects, handlers here 591→ return { /* exported API */ }; 592→} 593→``` 594→ 595→### Secure Storage Pattern 596→[DESCRIPTION]: Encrypt sensitive data in localStorage 597→[USED_FOR]: Auth tokens, session IDs 598→[ENCRYPTION]: AES encryption 599→ 600→```javascript 601→import { setSecureItem, getSecureItem, removeSecureItem } from 'lib/secureStorage.js'; 602→ 603→// Store encrypted 604→setSecureItem('splitlease_auth_token', token); 605→ 606→// Retrieve and decrypt 607→const token = getSecureItem('splitlease_auth_token'); 608→ 609→// Remove 610→removeSecureItem('splitlease_auth_token'); 611→``` 612→ 613→### API Proxy Pattern 614→[DESCRIPTION]: All Bubble API calls go through Supabase Edge Functions 615→[REASON]: Keep API keys server-side 616→[NEVER]: Call Bubble API directly from frontend 617→ 618→```javascript 619→import { bubbleAPI } from 'lib/bubbleAPI.js'; 620→ 621→// Proxied through Edge Function 622→const listing = await bubbleAPI.getListing(listingId); 623→``` 624→ 625→--- 626→ 627→## IMPORT_ALIASES 628→ 629→[ALIAS]: logic/* → C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\logic/* 630→[ALIAS]: lib/* → C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\lib/* 631→[ALIAS]: islands/* → C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\islands/* 632→[ALIAS]: styles/* → C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\styles/* 633→ 634→```javascript 635→// Use absolute imports from src/ 636→import { calculateFourWeekRent } from 'logic/calculators/pricing/calculateFourWeekRent.js'; 637→import { checkAuthStatus } from 'lib/auth.js'; 638→import Button from 'islands/shared/Button.jsx'; 639→``` 640→ 641→--- 642→ 643→## KEY_DATA_FLOWS 644→ 645→### Authentication Flow 646→[ENTRY]: User submits login form 647→[STEP_1]: lib/auth.js → loginUser() 648→[STEP_2]: Supabase Edge Function auth-user 649→[STEP_3]: Bubble API validates credentials 650→[STEP_4]: Token stored via lib/secureStorage.js 651→[STEP_5]: User type stored (Host/Guest) 652→[EXIT]: Redirect to dashboard 653→ 654→### Proposal Creation Flow 655→[ENTRY]: Guest clicks "Book" on listing 656→[STEP_1]: islands/shared/CreateProposalFlowV2.jsx modal opens 657→[STEP_2]: User selects days (uses day conversion) 658→[STEP_3]: logic/calculators/pricing calculates prices 659→[STEP_4]: logic/rules/proposals validates proposal 660→[STEP_5]: logic/workflows/proposals orchestrates submission 661→[STEP_6]: Supabase Edge Function → Bubble API 662→[EXIT]: Redirect to guest-proposals page 663→ 664→### Listing Search Flow 665→[ENTRY]: User visits /search 666→[STEP_1]: islands/pages/SearchPage.jsx renders 667→[STEP_2]: User sets filters (days, price, location) 668→[STEP_3]: lib/dataLookups.js fetches listings from Supabase 669→[STEP_4]: logic/rules/search validates filters 670→[STEP_5]: islands/shared/GoogleMap.jsx displays results 671→[EXIT]: User clicks listing → /view-split-lease/:id 672→ 673→--- 674→ 675→## SUBDIRECTORY_DOCUMENTATION 676→ 677→[islands/CLAUDE.md]: Component library documentation 678→[logic/CLAUDE.md]: Four-layer logic documentation 679→[lib/CLAUDE.md]: Utilities and API clients documentation 680→[styles/CLAUDE.md]: Styling conventions and CSS documentation 681→ 682→--- 683→ 684→## USAGE_NOTES 685→ 686→### When Adding New Page 687→1. Create HTML file in app/public/ 688→2. Create JSX entry point in app/src/ 689→3. Create page component in app/src/islands/pages/ 690→4. Create logic hook in app/src/islands/pages/use*PageLogic.js 691→5. Add route to routes.config.js 692→6. Run: bun run generate-routes 693→ 694→### When Adding Business Logic 695→1. Determine layer: calculator, rule, processor, or workflow 696→2. Create file in appropriate logic/* subdirectory 697→3. Follow naming convention for layer 698→4. Write pure function with single responsibility 699→5. Export from layer's index.js 700→ 701→### When Adding API Call 702→1. Add function to lib/bubbleAPI.js or lib/supabase.js 703→2. Use Edge Function proxy for Bubble API 704→3. Add error handling 705→4. Use secure storage for tokens 706→ 707→### When Converting Days 708→1. Identify system boundary (Bubble API ↔ Internal) 709→2. Use adaptDaysFromBubble when receiving from Bubble 710→3. Use adaptDaysToBubble when sending to Bubble 711→4. NEVER mix 0-based and 1-based in same function 712→ 713→--- 714→ 715→## CRITICAL_FILES 716→ 717→### Must Read Before Changes 718→[FILE]: routes.config.js - Route definitions 719→[FILE]: lib/constants.js - All configuration 720→[FILE]: lib/auth.js - Authentication system 721→[FILE]: logic/processors/external/adaptDays*.js - Day conversion 722→ 723→### Don't Modify 724→[DIR]: routes/ - Auto-generated 725→[FILE]: Any file in logic/ without understanding four-layer pattern 726→ 727→--- 728→ 729→## METRICS 730→ 731→[ENTRY_POINTS]: 29 732→[LOGIC_FILES]: 57 733→[LIB_FILES]: 24 734→[TOTAL_FILES]: 150+ 735→[CALCULATORS]: 9 736→[RULES]: 22 737→[PROCESSORS]: 14 738→[WORKFLOWS]: 12 739→[CSS_FILES]: 10+ global 740→[ROUTES]: 30+ 741→ 742→--- 743→ 744→**VERSION**: 5.0 745→**LAST_UPDATED**: 2025-12-11 746→**MAINTAINER**: Claude Code 747→ Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

lib/supabaseUtils.js [INTENT]: Supabase helper utilities [EXPORTS]: Query builders, formatters ### lib/constants/ [FILE]: proposalStages.js [FILE]: proposalStatuses.js ### lib/proposals/ [FILE]: dataTransformers.js [FILE]: statusButtonConfig.js ### lib/scheduleSelector/ [FILE]: dayHelpers.js [FILE]: nightCalculations.js [FILE]: priceCalculations.js [FILE]: validators.js --- ## ROUTING_SYSTEM ### routes.config.js [INTENT]: Single source of truth for all routes [EXPORTS]: routes array, route helper functions [USED_BY]: Vite config, Cloudflare config generators [PATTERN]: Each route defines path, file, protected, cloudflareInternal [TOTAL_ROUTES]: 30+ routes [DYNAMIC_ROUTES]: Support :param syntax for URL parameters [PROTECTED_ROUTES]: Require authentication check [CLOUDFLARE_INTERNAL]: Use _internal/ directory to avoid 308 redirects ### Route Helpers [FUNCTION]: matchRoute(url, route) - Check URL against route pattern [FUNCTION]: findRouteForUrl(url) - Find matching route for URL [FUNCTION]: buildRollupInputs(publicDir) - Generate Vite build inputs [FUNCTION]: getInternalRoutes() - Get routes needing _internal/ handling --- ## STYLING_SYSTEM ### styles/variables.css [INTENT]: CSS custom properties for theming [EXPORTS]: --color-*, --spacing-*, --font-* variables [USED_BY]: All CSS files ### Global Styles [FILE]: main.css - Global resets, base styles [FILE]: reset-password.css - Reset password page [FILE]: careers.css - Careers page [FILE]: faq.css - FAQ page [FILE]: help-center.css - Help center pages [FILE]: list-with-us.css - List with us page [FILE]: why-split-lease.css - Why Split Lease page [FILE]: listing-schedule-selector.css - Schedule selector component [FILE]: create-proposal-flow-v2.css - Proposal flow modal ### styles/components/ [INTENT]: Component-specific CSS [PATTERN]: Matches component name from islands/ --- ## CRITICAL_PATTERNS ### Day Indexing Convention [INTERNAL]: JavaScript 0-6 (Sunday=0, Monday=1, ..., Saturday=6) [BUBBLE_API]: Bubble 1-7 (Sunday=1, Monday=2, ..., Saturday=7) [CONVERSION]: ALWAYS use adaptDaysFromBubble/adaptDaysToBubble at boundaries [LOCATION]: logic/processors/external/ ```javascript import { adaptDaysFromBubble } from 'logic/processors/external/adaptDaysFromBubble.js'; import { adaptDaysToBubble } from 'logic/processors/external/adaptDaysToBubble.js'; // Receiving from Bubble API const jsDays = adaptDaysFromBubble({ bubbleDays: [2, 3, 4, 5, 6] }); // → [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] // Sending to Bubble API const bubbleDays = adaptDaysToBubble({ jsDays: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] }); // → [2, 3, 4, 5, 6] ``` ### Hollow Component Pattern [DESCRIPTION]: UI component delegates ALL logic to custom hook [COMPONENT]: Contains only JSX rendering [HOOK]: Contains all state, effects, handlers [BENEFIT]: Testable logic, focused rendering, reusable logic ```javascript // islands/pages/ViewSplitLeasePage.jsx export default function ViewSplitLeasePage() { const logic = useViewSplitLeasePageLogic(); return
{/* Pure JSX using logic.* */}
; } // islands/pages/useViewSplitLeasePageLogic.js export function useViewSplitLeasePageLogic() { // ALL state, effects, handlers here return { /* exported API */ }; } ``` ### Secure Storage Pattern [DESCRIPTION]: Encrypt sensitive data in localStorage [USED_FOR]: Auth tokens, session IDs [ENCRYPTION]: AES encryption ```javascript import { setSecureItem, getSecureItem, removeSecureItem } from 'lib/secureStorage.js'; // Store encrypted setSecureItem('splitlease_auth_token', token); // Retrieve and decrypt const token = getSecureItem('splitlease_auth_token'); // Remove removeSecureItem('splitlease_auth_token'); ``` ### API Proxy Pattern [DESCRIPTION]: All Bubble API calls go through Supabase Edge Functions [REASON]: Keep API keys server-side [NEVER]: Call Bubble API directly from frontend ```javascript import { bubbleAPI } from 'lib/bubbleAPI.js'; // Proxied through Edge Function const listing = await bubbleAPI.getListing(listingId); ``` --- ## IMPORT_ALIASES [ALIAS]: logic/* → C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\logic/* [ALIAS]: lib/* → C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\lib/* [ALIAS]: islands/* → C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\islands/* [ALIAS]: styles/* → C:\Users\Split Lease\Documents\Split Lease\app\src\styles/* ```javascript // Use absolute imports from src/ import { calculateFourWeekRent } from 'logic/calculators/pricing/calculateFourWeekRent.js'; import { checkAuthStatus } from 'lib/auth.js'; import Button from 'islands/shared/Button.jsx'; ``` --- ## KEY_DATA_FLOWS ### Authentication Flow [ENTRY]: User submits login form [STEP_1]: lib/auth.js → loginUser() [STEP_2]: Supabase Edge Function auth-user [STEP_3]: Bubble API validates credentials [STEP_4]: Token stored via lib/secureStorage.js [STEP_5]: User type stored (Host/Guest) [EXIT]: Redirect to dashboard ### Proposal Creation Flow [ENTRY]: Guest clicks "Book" on listing [STEP_1]: islands/shared/CreateProposalFlowV2.jsx modal opens [STEP_2]: User selects days (uses day conversion) [STEP_3]: logic/calculators/pricing calculates prices [STEP_4]: logic/rules/proposals validates proposal [STEP_5]: logic/workflows/proposals orchestrates submission [STEP_6]: Supabase Edge Function → Bubble API [EXIT]: Redirect to guest-proposals page ### Listing Search Flow [ENTRY]: User visits /search [STEP_1]: islands/pages/SearchPage.jsx renders [STEP_2]: User sets filters (days, price, location) [STEP_3]: lib/dataLookups.js fetches listings from Supabase [STEP_4]: logic/rules/search validates filters [STEP_5]: islands/shared/GoogleMap.jsx displays results [EXIT]: User clicks listing → /view-split-lease/:id --- ## SUBDIRECTORY_DOCUMENTATION [islands/CLAUDE.md]: Component library documentation [logic/CLAUDE.md]: Four-layer logic documentation [lib/CLAUDE.md]: Utilities and API clients documentation [styles/CLAUDE.md]: Styling conventions and CSS documentation --- ## USAGE_NOTES ### When Adding New Page 1. Create HTML file in app/public/ 2. Create JSX entry point in app/src/ 3. Create page component in app/src/islands/pages/ 4. Create logic hook in app/src/islands/pages/use*PageLogic.js 5. Add route to routes.config.js 6. Run: bun run generate-routes ### When Adding Business Logic 1. Determine layer: calculator, rule, processor, or workflow 2. Create file in appropriate logic/* subdirectory 3. Follow naming convention for layer 4. Write pure function with single responsibility 5. Export from layer's index.js ### When Adding API Call 1. Add function to lib/bubbleAPI.js or lib/supabase.js 2. Use Edge Function proxy for Bubble API 3. Add error handling 4. Use secure storage for tokens ### When Converting Days 1. Identify system boundary (Bubble API ↔ Internal) 2. Use adaptDaysFromBubble when receiving from Bubble 3. Use adaptDaysToBubble when sending to Bubble 4. NEVER mix 0-based and 1-based in same function --- ## CRITICAL_FILES ### Must Read Before Changes [FILE]: routes.config.js - Route definitions [FILE]: lib/constants.js - All configuration [FILE]: lib/auth.js - Authentication system [FILE]: logic/processors/external/adaptDays*.js - Day conversion ### Don't Modify [DIR]: routes/ - Auto-generated [FILE]: Any file in logic/ without understanding four-layer pattern --- ## METRICS [ENTRY_POINTS]: 29 [LOGIC_FILES]: 57 [LIB_FILES]: 24 [TOTAL_FILES]: 150+ [CALCULATORS]: 9 [RULES]: 22 [PROCESSORS]: 14 [WORKFLOWS]: 12 [CSS_FILES]: 10+ global [ROUTES]: 30+ --- **VERSION**: 5.0 **LAST_UPDATED**: 2025-12-11 **MAINTAINER**: Claude Code

1→/**
     2→ * Quick Match Scoring Constants
     3→ *
     4→ * Defines weights, thresholds, and reference data for the matching algorithm.
     5→ * Maximum possible score is 95 (price drop heuristic not implemented due to missing data).
     6→ *
     7→ * @module logic/calculators/matching/constants
     8→ */
     9→
    10→/**
    11→ * Score weights for each matching criterion.
    12→ * Total: 95 points (5 points unavailable due to missing price history data)
    13→ */
    14→export const MATCH_WEIGHTS = {
    15→  BOROUGH: 25,        // Location proximity
    16→  PRICE: 20,          // Price similarity
    17→  SCHEDULE: 20,       // Schedule day overlap
    18→  WEEKLY_STAY: 15,    // Support for 7-night stays
    19→  DURATION: 10,       // Minimum nights compatibility
    20→  HOST: 5             // Host verification proxy
    21→  // PRICE_DROP: 5    // Not implemented (no price history tracking)
    22→};
    23→
    24→/**
    25→ * NYC borough adjacency map for location scoring.
    26→ * Adjacent boroughs receive partial score (15 points vs 25 for exact match).
    27→ */
    28→export const NYC_BOROUGH_ADJACENCY = {
    29→  manhattan: ['brooklyn', 'queens', 'bronx'],
    30→  brooklyn: ['manhattan', 'queens', 'staten island'],
    31→  queens: ['manhattan', 'brooklyn', 'bronx'],
    32→  bronx: ['manhattan', 'queens'],
    33→  'staten island': ['brooklyn']
    34→};
    35→
    36→/**
    37→ * Score tiers for categorizing match quality.
    38→ * Used by formatMatchResult to assign tier labels.
    39→ */
    40→export const SCORE_TIERS = {
    41→  EXCELLENT: 75,  // 75+ = excellent match
    42→  GOOD: 50,       // 50-74 = good match
    43→  FAIR: 25        // 25-49 = fair match, below = poor match
    44→};
    45→
    46→/**
    47→ * Price proximity thresholds for scoring.
    48→ * Each threshold maps to a score value.
    49→ */
    50→export const PRICE_THRESHOLDS = {
    51→  WITHIN_10_PERCENT: 0.10,  // 20 points
    52→  WITHIN_20_PERCENT: 0.20,  // 15 points
    53→  WITHIN_30_PERCENT: 0.30,  // 10 points
    54→  WITHIN_50_PERCENT: 0.50   // 5 points
    55→};
    56→
    57→/**
    58→ * Minimum verification count for host to be considered "verified".
    59→ */
    60→export const MIN_HOST_VERIFICATIONS = 2;
    61→
    62→/**
    63→ * Maximum possible score with current data availability.
    64→ */
    65→export const MAX_POSSIBLE_SCORE = 95;
    66→
    67→/**
    68→ * Tier labels for display.
    69→ */
    70→export const TIER_LABELS = {
    71→  EXCELLENT: 'excellent',
    72→  GOOD: 'good',
    73→  FAIR: 'fair',
    74→  POOR: 'poor'
    75→};
    76→

1→/**
     2→ * Calculate price proximity ratio between candidate listing and proposal.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Measure how close candidate pricing is to proposal budget.
     5→ * @rule Returns absolute difference as decimal ratio (0.0 = exact match).
     6→ * @rule Uses matching night count for fair comparison.
     7→ * @rule Throws if proposal nightly price is missing or invalid.
     8→ *
     9→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    10→ * @param {number} params.candidateNightlyRate - Candidate listing's nightly rate.
    11→ * @param {number} params.proposalNightlyRate - Proposal's nightly rate.
    12→ * @returns {number} Price difference as decimal (e.g., 0.15 = 15% difference).
    13→ *
    14→ * @throws {Error} If proposalNightlyRate is missing, zero, or invalid.
    15→ *
    16→ * @example
    17→ * calculatePriceProximity({
    18→ *   candidateNightlyRate: 115,
    19→ *   proposalNightlyRate: 100
    20→ * })
    21→ * // => 0.15 (15% higher)
    22→ *
    23→ * calculatePriceProximity({
    24→ *   candidateNightlyRate: 85,
    25→ *   proposalNightlyRate: 100
    26→ * })
    27→ * // => 0.15 (15% lower - absolute value)
    28→ */
    29→export function calculatePriceProximity({ candidateNightlyRate, proposalNightlyRate }) {
    30→  // Validate proposal rate
    31→  if (typeof proposalNightlyRate !== 'number' || isNaN(proposalNightlyRate)) {
    32→    throw new Error(
    33→      `calculatePriceProximity: proposalNightlyRate must be a valid number, got ${typeof proposalNightlyRate}`
    34→    );
    35→  }
    36→
    37→  if (proposalNightlyRate <= 0) {
    38→    throw new Error(
    39→      'calculatePriceProximity: proposalNightlyRate must be greater than 0'
    40→    );
    41→  }
    42→
    43→  // Validate candidate rate
    44→  if (typeof candidateNightlyRate !== 'number' || isNaN(candidateNightlyRate)) {
    45→    throw new Error(
    46→      `calculatePriceProximity: candidateNightlyRate must be a valid number, got ${typeof candidateNightlyRate}`
    47→    );
    48→  }
    49→
    50→  if (candidateNightlyRate < 0) {
    51→    throw new Error(
    52→      'calculatePriceProximity: candidateNightlyRate cannot be negative'
    53→    );
    54→  }
    55→
    56→  const priceDifference = Math.abs(candidateNightlyRate - proposalNightlyRate);
    57→  const proximityRatio = priceDifference / proposalNightlyRate;
    58→
    59→  return proximityRatio;
    60→}
    61→

1→/**
     2→ * Calculate detailed heuristics for a match (boolean flags).
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Provide granular boolean indicators for each matching criterion.
     5→ * @rule Returns true/false for each heuristic for UI display or filtering.
     6→ * @rule Useful for displaying match reasoning to users.
     7→ *
     8→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
     9→ * @param {object} params.candidateListing - Candidate listing with all fields.
    10→ * @param {object} params.proposal - Proposal object with nested listing/host data.
    11→ * @param {object} params.hostData - Host/user data for candidate listing.
    12→ * @returns {object} Boolean flags for each heuristic.
    13→ *
    14→ * @example
    15→ * calculateMatchHeuristics({
    16→ *   candidateListing: { boroughName: 'Manhattan', ... },
    17→ *   proposal: { ... },
    18→ *   hostData: { ... }
    19→ * })
    20→ * // => {
    21→ * //   boroughMatch: true,
    22→ * //   boroughAdjacent: false,
    23→ * //   priceWithin10Percent: true,
    24→ * //   priceWithin20Percent: true,
    25→ * //   priceWithin30Percent: true,
    26→ * //   hasScheduleOverlap: true,
    27→ * //   hasFullScheduleOverlap: true,
    28→ * //   supportsWeeklyStays: true,
    29→ * //   durationMatch: true,
    30→ * //   hostVerified: true,
    31→ * //   priceDrop: false
    32→ * // }
    33→ */
    34→import { isBoroughMatch } from '../../rules/matching/isBoroughMatch.js';
    35→import { isBoroughAdjacent } from '../../rules/matching/isBoroughAdjacent.js';
    36→import { hasScheduleCompatibility } from '../../rules/matching/hasScheduleCompatibility.js';
    37→import { supportsWeeklyStays } from '../../rules/matching/supportsWeeklyStays.js';
    38→import { isDurationMatch } from '../../rules/matching/isDurationMatch.js';
    39→import { isVerifiedHost } from '../../rules/matching/isVerifiedHost.js';
    40→import { calculatePriceProximity } from './calculatePriceProximity.js';
    41→import { getNightlyRateByFrequency } from '../pricing/getNightlyRateByFrequency.js';
    42→import { PRICE_THRESHOLDS } from './constants.js';
    43→
    44→export function calculateMatchHeuristics({ candidateListing, proposal, hostData }) {
    45→  // Extract boroughs
    46→  const candidateBorough =
    47→    candidateListing?.boroughName ||
    48→    candidateListing?.['Location - Borough'] ||
    49→    null;
    50→
    51→  const proposalBorough =
    52→    proposal?.listing?.boroughName ||
    53→    proposal?.listing?.borough ||
    54→    proposal?.listing?.['Location - Borough'] ||
    55→    null;
    56→
    57→  // Calculate price proximity
    58→  let proximity = null;
    59→  try {
    60→    const nightsPerWeek =
    61→      proposal?.nightsPerWeek ||
    62→      proposal?.daysSelected?.length ||
    63→      4;
    64→
    65→    const proposalNightlyRate = proposal?.nightlyPrice;
    66→    const candidateNightlyRate = getNightlyRateByFrequency({
    67→      listing: candidateListing,
    68→      nightsSelected: nightsPerWeek
    69→    });
    70→
    71→    if (proposalNightlyRate && candidateNightlyRate) {
    72→      proximity = calculatePriceProximity({
    73→        candidateNightlyRate,
    74→        proposalNightlyRate
    75→      });
    76→    }
    77→  } catch {
    78→    // Price proximity calculation failed, leave as null
    79→  }
    80→
    81→  // Calculate schedule compatibility
    82→  const scheduleResult = hasScheduleCompatibility({ candidateListing, proposal });
    83→
    84→  // Borough checks
    85→  const isExactBoroughMatch =
    86→    candidateBorough &&
    87→    proposalBorough &&
    88→    candidateBorough.toLowerCase().trim() === proposalBorough.toLowerCase().trim();
    89→
    90→  const isAdjacentBorough = isBoroughAdjacent({
    91→    borough1: proposalBorough,
    92→    borough2: candidateBorough
    93→  });
    94→
    95→  return {
    96→    // Borough heuristics
    97→    boroughMatch: isBoroughMatch({ candidateBorough, proposalBorough }),
    98→    boroughExact: isExactBoroughMatch,
    99→    boroughAdjacent: isAdjacentBorough,
   100→
   101→    // Price heuristics
   102→    priceWithin10Percent: proximity !== null && proximity <= PRICE_THRESHOLDS.WITHIN_10_PERCENT,
   103→    priceWithin20Percent: proximity !== null && proximity <= PRICE_THRESHOLDS.WITHIN_20_PERCENT,
   104→    priceWithin30Percent: proximity !== null && proximity <= PRICE_THRESHOLDS.WITHIN_30_PERCENT,
   105→    priceWithin50Percent: proximity !== null && proximity <= PRICE_THRESHOLDS.WITHIN_50_PERCENT,
   106→
   107→    // Schedule heuristics
   108→    hasScheduleOverlap: scheduleResult.compatible,
   109→    hasFullScheduleOverlap:
   110→      scheduleResult.compatible &&
   111→      scheduleResult.overlapDays === scheduleResult.requestedDays,
   112→    scheduleOverlapPercent:
   113→      scheduleResult.requestedDays > 0
   114→        ? Math.round((scheduleResult.overlapDays / scheduleResult.requestedDays) * 100)
   115→        : 0,
   116→
   117→    // Weekly stay heuristic
   118→    supportsWeeklyStays: supportsWeeklyStays({ listing: candidateListing }),
   119→
   120→    // Duration heuristic
   121→    durationMatch: isDurationMatch({ listing: candidateListing, proposal }),
   122→
   123→    // Host heuristic
   124→    hostVerified: isVerifiedHost({ host: hostData }),
   125→
   126→    // Price drop (not implemented)
   127→    priceDrop: false
   128→  };
   129→}
   130→

1→/**
     2→ * Calculate overall match score for a candidate listing.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Master scoring function combining all matching heuristics.
     5→ * @rule Sums individual scores for borough, price, schedule, weekly stay, duration, and host.
     6→ * @rule Maximum possible score is 95 (price drop heuristic not implemented).
     7→ * @rule Returns breakdown for transparency and debugging.
     8→ *
     9→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    10→ * @param {object} params.candidateListing - Candidate listing with all fields.
    11→ * @param {object} params.proposal - Proposal object with nested listing/host data.
    12→ * @param {object} params.hostData - Host/user data for candidate listing.
    13→ * @returns {object} { totalScore, breakdown, maxPossibleScore }
    14→ *
    15→ * @example
    16→ * calculateMatchScore({
    17→ *   candidateListing: {
    18→ *     boroughName: 'Manhattan',
    19→ *     '💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights': 105,
    20→ *     'Schedule days available': [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6],
    21→ *     'Minimum Nights': 4
    22→ *   },
    23→ *   proposal: {
    24→ *     nightlyPrice: 100,
    25→ *     nightsPerWeek: 4,
    26→ *     daysSelected: [1, 2, 3, 4],
    27→ *     listing: { boroughName: 'Manhattan' }
    28→ *   },
    29→ *   hostData: {
    30→ *     'Verify - Linked In ID': true,
    31→ *     'Verify - Phone': true,
    32→ *     'user verified?': false
    33→ *   }
    34→ * })
    35→ * // => {
    36→ * //   totalScore: 90,
    37→ * //   breakdown: {
    38→ * //     boroughMatch: 25,
    39→ * //     priceProximity: 20,
    40→ * //     scheduleOverlap: 20,
    41→ * //     weeklyStaySupport: 15,
    42→ * //     durationMatch: 10,
    43→ * //     hostVerified: 3,
    44→ * //     priceDrop: 0
    45→ * //   },
    46→ * //   maxPossibleScore: 95
    47→ * // }
    48→ */
    49→import { calculateBoroughScore } from './calculateBoroughScore.js';
    50→import { calculatePriceScore } from './calculatePriceScore.js';
    51→import { calculateScheduleOverlapScore } from './calculateScheduleOverlapScore.js';
    52→import { calculateWeeklyStayScore } from './calculateWeeklyStayScore.js';
    53→import { calculateDurationScore } from './calculateDurationScore.js';
    54→import { calculateHostScore } from './calculateHostScore.js';
    55→import { MAX_POSSIBLE_SCORE } from './constants.js';
    56→
    57→export function calculateMatchScore({ candidateListing, proposal, hostData }) {
    58→  // Calculate individual scores
    59→  const scores = {
    60→    boroughMatch: calculateBoroughScore({ candidateListing, proposal }),           // 0-25
    61→    priceProximity: calculatePriceScore({ candidateListing, proposal }),           // 0-20
    62→    scheduleOverlap: calculateScheduleOverlapScore({ candidateListing, proposal }), // 0-20
    63→    weeklyStaySupport: calculateWeeklyStayScore({ candidateListing }),             // 0-15
    64→    durationMatch: calculateDurationScore({ candidateListing, proposal }),          // 0-10
    65→    hostVerified: calculateHostScore({ hostData }),                                 // 0-5
    66→    priceDrop: 0 // Not implemented (no price history tracking)                     // 0
    67→  };
    68→
    69→  // Sum all scores
    70→  const totalScore = Object.values(scores).reduce((sum, score) => sum + score, 0);
    71→
    72→  return {
    73→    totalScore,
    74→    breakdown: scores,
    75→    maxPossibleScore: MAX_POSSIBLE_SCORE
    76→  };
    77→}
    78→

1→/**
     2→ * Check if host has sufficient verification status.
     3→ *
     4→ * @intent Determine host trustworthiness based on verification fields.
     5→ * @rule Counts LinkedIn, Phone, and user verified fields.
     6→ * @rule Host is "verified" if they have >= minimum verifications (default 2).
     7→ * @rule Used as proxy for host responsiveness (no response rate data available).
     8→ *
     9→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    10→ * @param {object} params.host - Host/user object with verification fields.
    11→ * @param {number} [params.minVerifications=2] - Minimum verifications required.
    12→ * @returns {boolean} True if host meets verification threshold.
    13→ *
    14→ * @example
    15→ * isVerifiedHost({
    16→ *   host: {
    17→ *     'Verify - Linked In ID': true,
    18→ *     'Verify - Phone': true,
    19→ *     'user verified?': false
    20→ *   }
    21→ * })
    22→ * // => true (2 verifications meet default minimum of 2)
    23→ *
    24→ * isVerifiedHost({
    25→ *   host: {
    26→ *     'Verify - Linked In ID': false,
    27→ *     'Verify - Phone': true,
    28→ *     'user verified?': false
    29→ *   }
    30→ * })
    31→ * // => false (only 1 verification)
    32→ */
    33→import { MIN_HOST_VERIFICATIONS } from '../../calculators/matching/constants.js';
    34→
    35→export function isVerifiedHost({ host, minVerifications = MIN_HOST_VERIFICATIONS }) {
    36→  if (!host) {
    37→    return false;
    38→  }
    39→
    40→  // Count verification fields
    41→  const verifications = [
    42→    host['Verify - Linked In ID'] || host.linkedInVerified || false,
    43→    host['Verify - Phone'] || host.phoneVerified || false,
    44→    host['user verified?'] || host.userVerified || false
    45→  ];
    46→
    47→  const verificationCount = verifications.filter(Boolean).length;
    48→
    49→  return verificationCount >= minVerifications;
    50→}
    51→
    52→/**
    53→ * Count the number of verifications a host has.
    54→ *
    55→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    56→ * @param {object} params.host - Host/user object with verification fields.
    57→ * @returns {number} Count of verifications (0-3).
    58→ *
    59→ * @example
    60→ * countHostVerifications({
    61→ *   host: {
    62→ *     'Verify - Linked In ID': true,
    63→ *     'Verify - Phone': true,
    64→ *     'user verified?': true
    65→ *   }
    66→ * })
    67→ * // => 3
    68→ */
    69→export function countHostVerifications({ host }) {
    70→  if (!host) {
    71→    return 0;
    72→  }
    73→
    74→  const verifications = [
    75→    host['Verify - Linked In ID'] || host.linkedInVerified || false,
    76→    host['Verify - Phone'] || host.phoneVerified || false,
    77→    host['user verified?'] || host.userVerified || false
    78→  ];
    79→
    80→  return verifications.filter(Boolean).length;
    81→}
    82→

1→/**
     2→ * Get nightly price based on number of nights selected.
     3→ * Matches Bubble logic for price field selection.
     4→ *
     5→ * @intent Retrieve the appropriate nightly rate tier based on frequency.
     6→ * @rule Price override takes precedence over frequency-based rates.
     7→ * @rule Frequency-specific rates (2, 3, 4, 5, 7 nights) map to specific price fields.
     8→ * @rule No fallback to default rate - throws if no valid rate found.
     9→ *
    10→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    11→ * @param {object} params.listing - Listing object with price fields.
    12→ * @param {number} params.nightsSelected - Number of nights per week (2-7).
    13→ * @returns {number} Nightly price for the selected frequency.
    14→ *
    15→ * @throws {Error} If listing is missing or invalid.
    16→ * @throws {Error} If nightsSelected is not a number or out of range.
    17→ * @throws {Error} If no valid price found for the selected nights.
    18→ *
    19→ * @example
    20→ * const rate = getNightlyRateByFrequency({
    21→ *   listing: { '💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights': 100 },
    22→ *   nightsSelected: 4
    23→ * })
    24→ * // => 100
    25→ */
    26→export function getNightlyRateByFrequency({ listing, nightsSelected }) {
    27→  // No Fallback: Validate listing exists
    28→  if (!listing || typeof listing !== 'object') {
    29→    throw new Error(
    30→      'getNightlyRateByFrequency: listing must be a valid object'
    31→    )
    32→  }
    33→
    34→  // No Fallback: Validate nightsSelected
    35→  if (typeof nightsSelected !== 'number' || isNaN(nightsSelected)) {
    36→    throw new Error(
    37→      `getNightlyRateByFrequency: nightsSelected must be a number, got ${typeof nightsSelected}`
    38→    )
    39→  }
    40→
    41→  if (nightsSelected < 2 || nightsSelected > 7) {
    42→    throw new Error(
    43→      `getNightlyRateByFrequency: nightsSelected must be between 2-7, got ${nightsSelected}`
    44→    )
    45→  }
    46→
    47→  // Price override takes precedence
    48→  if (listing['💰Price Override']) {
    49→    const overridePrice = Number(listing['💰Price Override'])
    50→    if (isNaN(overridePrice) || overridePrice < 0) {
    51→      throw new Error(
    52→        `getNightlyRateByFrequency: Invalid price override value ${listing['💰Price Override']}`
    53→      )
    54→    }
    55→    return overridePrice
    56→  }
    57→
    58→  // Map nights to price fields
    59→  const priceFieldMap = {
    60→    1: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 1 night',
    61→    2: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 2 nights',
    62→    3: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 3 nights',
    63→    4: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights',
    64→    5: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 5 nights',
    65→    6: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 6 nights',
    66→    7: '💰Nightly Host Rate for 7 nights'
    67→  }
    68→
    69→  const fieldName = priceFieldMap[nightsSelected]
    70→
    71→  // No Fallback: Exact match required
    72→  if (!fieldName || !listing[fieldName]) {
    73→    throw new Error(
    74→      `getNightlyRateByFrequency: No price found for ${nightsSelected} nights in listing`
    75→    )
    76→  }
    77→
    78→  const rate = Number(listing[fieldName])
    79→
    80→  if (isNaN(rate) || rate < 0) {
    81→    throw new Error(
    82→      `getNightlyRateByFrequency: Invalid rate value ${listing[fieldName]} for ${nightsSelected} nights`
    83→    )
    84→  }
    85→
    86→  return rate
    87→}
    88→

1→import { getNightlyRateByFrequency } from './getNightlyRateByFrequency.js'
     2→import { calculateFourWeekRent } from './calculateFourWeekRent.js'
     3→import { calculateReservationTotal } from './calculateReservationTotal.js'
     4→import { validateNumber } from '../../validators/pricingValidators.js'
     5→
     6→/**
     7→ * Calculate complete pricing breakdown for a listing rental.
     8→ *
     9→ * @intent Provide comprehensive price calculation including all fees.
    10→ * @rule Combines nightly rate, 4-week rent, reservation total, and fees.
    11→ * @rule All calculations must succeed or throw - no partial results.
    12→ *
    13→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    14→ * @param {object} params.listing - Listing object with all pricing fields.
    15→ * @param {number} params.nightsPerWeek - Nights selected per week (2-7).
    16→ * @param {number} params.reservationWeeks - Total reservation span in weeks.
    17→ * @returns {object} Complete pricing breakdown with all calculated values.
    18→ *
    19→ * @throws {Error} If any required parameter is missing or invalid.
    20→ * @throws {Error} If any calculation in the chain fails.
    21→ *
    22→ * @example
    23→ * const breakdown = calculatePricingBreakdown({
    24→ *   listing: { '💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights': 100, '💰Cleaning Cost / Maintenance Fee': 50 },
    25→ *   nightsPerWeek: 4,
    26→ *   reservationWeeks: 13
    27→ * })
    28→ * // => { nightlyPrice: 100, fourWeekRent: 1600, reservationTotal: 5200, ... }
    29→ */
    30→export function calculatePricingBreakdown({ listing, nightsPerWeek, reservationWeeks }) {
    31→  // No Fallback: Validate all inputs
    32→  if (!listing || typeof listing !== 'object') {
    33→    throw new Error(
    34→      'calculatePricingBreakdown: listing must be a valid object'
    35→    )
    36→  }
    37→
    38→  validateNumber(nightsPerWeek, 'nightsPerWeek', 'calculatePricingBreakdown')
    39→  validateNumber(reservationWeeks, 'reservationWeeks', 'calculatePricingBreakdown')
    40→
    41→  // Get nightly rate (throws if not found)
    42→  const nightlyPrice = getNightlyRateByFrequency({
    43→    listing,
    44→    nightsSelected: nightsPerWeek
    45→  })
    46→
    47→  // Calculate 4-week rent (throws on invalid input)
    48→  const fourWeekRent = calculateFourWeekRent({
    49→    nightlyRate: nightlyPrice,
    50→    frequency: nightsPerWeek
    51→  })
    52→
    53→  // Calculate reservation total (throws on invalid input)
    54→  const reservationTotal = calculateReservationTotal({
    55→    fourWeekRent,
    56→    totalWeeks: reservationWeeks
    57→  })
    58→
    59→  // Extract fees (with explicit validation)
    60→  const cleaningFee = extractFee(
    61→    listing['💰Cleaning Cost / Maintenance Fee'],
    62→    'Cleaning Fee'
    63→  )
    64→
    65→  const damageDeposit = extractFee(
    66→    listing['💰Damage Deposit'],
    67→    'Damage Deposit'
    68→  )
    69→
    70→  // Calculate grand total
    71→  const grandTotal = reservationTotal + cleaningFee
    72→
    73→  return {
    74→    nightlyPrice,
    75→    fourWeekRent,
    76→    reservationTotal,
    77→    cleaningFee,
    78→    damageDeposit,
    79→    grandTotal,
    80→    valid: true
    81→  }
    82→}
    83→
    84→/**
    85→ * Extract and validate a fee value from listing.
    86→ * Returns 0 for explicitly missing optional fees (null/undefined).
    87→ * Throws for invalid fee values.
    88→ *
    89→ * @param {any} feeValue - The fee value from listing
    90→ * @param {string} feeName - Name of fee for error messages
    91→ * @returns {number} Validated fee amount (0 if optional and missing)
    92→ * @throws {Error} If fee value is invalid (e.g., negative, NaN)
    93→ */
    94→function extractFee(feeValue, feeName) {
    95→  // Optional fees can be null/undefined - default to 0
    96→  if (feeValue === null || feeValue === undefined) {
    97→    return 0
    98→  }
    99→
   100→  const fee = Number(feeValue)
   101→
   102→  if (isNaN(fee)) {
   103→    throw new Error(
   104→      `calculatePricingBreakdown: ${feeName} has invalid value ${feeValue}`
   105→    )
   106→  }
   107→
   108→  if (fee < 0) {
   109→    throw new Error(
   110→      `calculatePricingBreakdown: ${feeName} cannot be negative, got ${fee}`
   111→    )
   112→  }
   113→
   114→  return fee
   115→}
   116→

1→/**
     2→ * Calculate guest-facing price per night after markup and discounts.
     3→ * This is the price displayed on listing cards in search results.
     4→ *
     5→ * @intent Calculate final guest-facing price from host compensation rate.
     6→ * @rule Apply 13% full-time discount for 7 nights only.
     7→ * @rule Apply 17% site markup to all prices.
     8→ * @rule Return price per night (total price / nights).
     9→ *
    10→ * Formula:
    11→ * 1. Base price = host rate × nights
    12→ * 2. Full-time discount = base price × 0.13 (only if 7 nights)
    13→ * 3. Price after discounts = base price - discount
    14→ * 4. Site markup = price after discounts × 0.17
    15→ * 5. Total price = base price - discount + markup
    16→ * 6. Price per night = total price / nights
    17→ *
    18→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters.
    19→ * @param {number} params.hostNightlyRate - Host compensation rate per night.
    20→ * @param {number} params.nightsCount - Number of nights selected (2-7).
    21→ * @returns {number} Guest-facing price per night.
    22→ *
    23→ * @throws {Error} If hostNightlyRate is not a valid positive number.
    24→ * @throws {Error} If nightsCount is not between 2-7.
    25→ *
    26→ * @example
    27→ * const price = calculateGuestFacingPrice({ hostNightlyRate: 100, nightsCount: 5 })
    28→ * // => 117 (per night, after markup)
    29→ *
    30→ * const fullWeekPrice = calculateGuestFacingPrice({ hostNightlyRate: 100, nightsCount: 7 })
    31→ * // => 102.35 (per night, with 13% discount + 17% markup)
    32→ */
    33→import { PRICING_CONSTANTS } from '../../constants/pricingConstants.js';
    34→
    35→export function calculateGuestFacingPrice({ hostNightlyRate, nightsCount }) {
    36→  // No Fallback: Strict validation
    37→  if (
    38→    typeof hostNightlyRate !== 'number' ||
    39→    isNaN(hostNightlyRate) ||
    40→    hostNightlyRate < 0
    41→  ) {
    42→    throw new Error(
    43→      `calculateGuestFacingPrice: hostNightlyRate must be a positive number, got ${hostNightlyRate}`
    44→    )
    45→  }
    46→
    47→  if (
    48→    typeof nightsCount !== 'number' ||
    49→    isNaN(nightsCount) ||
    50→    nightsCount < 2 ||
    51→    nightsCount > 7
    52→  ) {
    53→    throw new Error(
    54→      `calculateGuestFacingPrice: nightsCount must be between 2-7, got ${nightsCount}`
    55→    )
    56→  }
    57→
    58→  // Step 1: Calculate base price (host rate × nights)
    59→  const basePrice = hostNightlyRate * nightsCount
    60→
    61→  // Step 2: Apply full-time discount (only for 7 nights)
    62→  const fullTimeDiscount = nightsCount === PRICING_CONSTANTS.FULL_TIME_NIGHTS_THRESHOLD
    63→    ? basePrice * PRICING_CONSTANTS.FULL_TIME_DISCOUNT_RATE
    64→    : 0;
    65→
    66→  // Step 3: Price after discounts
    67→  const priceAfterDiscounts = basePrice - fullTimeDiscount;
    68→
    69→  // Step 4: Apply site markup
    70→  const siteMarkup = priceAfterDiscounts * PRICING_CONSTANTS.SITE_MARKUP_RATE;
    71→
    72→  // Step 5: Calculate total price
    73→  const totalPrice = basePrice - fullTimeDiscount + siteMarkup
    74→
    75→  // Step 6: Calculate price per night (guest-facing price)
    76→  const pricePerNight = totalPrice / nightsCount
    77→
    78→  return pricePerNight
    79→}
    80→

1→import { validateNonNegativeNumber, validateRange } from '../../validators/pricingValidators.js'
     2→
     3→/**
     4→ * Calculates the baseline rent for a standard 4-week period.
     5→ *
     6→ * @intent Determine the recurring monthly cost basis before fees.
     7→ * @rule Four weeks is the standard billing cycle for split lease.
     8→ *
     9→ * @param {object} params - Named parameters for clarity.
    10→ * @param {number} params.nightlyRate - The base cost per night in USD.
    11→ * @param {number} params.frequency - The number of nights per week (2-7).
    12→ * @returns {number} The total rent for a 4-week cycle.
    13→ *
    14→ * @throws {Error} If nightlyRate or frequency is not a number.
    15→ * @throws {Error} If nightlyRate is negative or NaN.
    16→ * @throws {Error} If frequency is outside the valid range (2-7).
    17→ *
    18→ * @example
    19→ * const rent = calculateFourWeekRent({ nightlyRate: 100, frequency: 4 })
    20→ * // => 1600 (100 * 4 * 4)
    21→ */
    22→export function calculateFourWeekRent({ nightlyRate, frequency }) {
    23→  // No Fallback: Strict type validation
    24→  validateNonNegativeNumber(nightlyRate, 'nightlyRate', 'calculateFourWeekRent')
    25→  validateRange(frequency, 2, 7, 'frequency', 'calculateFourWeekRent')
    26→
    27→  // Pure calculation
    28→  return nightlyRate * frequency * 4
    29→}

1→/**
     2→ * Adapt a raw listing record for the matching algorithm.

     4→ * @intent Transform raw database listing into normalized structure for matching.
     5→ * @rule Extracts only fields relevant to matching algorithm.
     6→ * @rule Normalizes field names from Bubble format.
     7→ * @rule Includes host verification count for scoring.
     8→ *
     9→ * @param {object} rawListing - Raw listing object from Supabase/Bubble.
    10→ * @returns {object} Adapted listing object for matching.
    11→ *
    12→ * @throws {Error} If rawListing is null or undefined.
    13→ *
    14→ * @example
    15→ * adaptCandidateListing({
    16→ *   _id: 'abc123',
    17→ *   'Location - Borough': 'Manhattan',
    18→ *   'Schedule days available': [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6],
    19→ *   'Minimum Nights': 3,
    20→ *   '💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights': 150,
    21→ *   'Host User': 'host123'
    22→ * })
    23→ * // => {
    24→ * //   id: 'abc123',
    25→ * //   borough: 'Manhattan',
    26→ * //   boroughName: 'Manhattan',

    33→import { countHostVerifications } from '../../rules/matching/isVerifiedHost.js';
    34→
    35→export function adaptCandidateListing(rawListing) {

    40→  // Extract host data if nested

    42→
    43→  // Extract address from JSONB structure
    44→  const addressData = rawListing['Location - Address'];

    47→      ? addressData.address
    48→      : typeof addressData === 'string'
    49→        ? addressData
    50→        : null;
    51→
    52→  return {
    53→    // Core identifiers

    56→
    57→    // Name and description
    58→    name: rawListing.Name || 'Untitled Listing',
    59→    description: rawListing.Description || null,
    60→
    61→    // Location
    62→    borough: rawListing['Location - Borough'] || null,
    63→    boroughName: rawListing.boroughName || rawListing['Location - Borough'] || null,
    64→    hood: rawListing['Location - Hood'] || null,
    65→    hoodName: rawListing.hoodName || null,
    66→    address: addressString,
    67→
    68→    // Availability & Scheduling

    72→
    73→    // Pricing (keep raw fields for getNightlyRateByFrequency)

    79→      rate6Nights: rawListing['💰Nightly Host Rate for 6 nights'] || null,

    82→      damageDeposit: rawListing['💰Damage Deposit'] || 0,
    83→      priceOverride: rawListing['💰Price Override'] || null
    84→    },
    85→
    86→    // Keep original pricing fields for calculator compatibility
    87→    '💰Nightly Host Rate for 1 night': rawListing['💰Nightly Host Rate for 1 night'] || null,
    88→    '💰Nightly Host Rate for 2 nights': rawListing['💰Nightly Host Rate for 2 nights'] || null,
    89→    '💰Nightly Host Rate for 3 nights': rawListing['💰Nightly Host Rate for 3 nights'] || null,
    90→    '💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights': rawListing['💰Nightly Host Rate for 4 nights'] || null,
    91→    '💰Nightly Host Rate for 5 nights': rawListing['💰Nightly Host Rate for 5 nights'] || null,
    92→    '💰Nightly Host Rate for 6 nights': rawListing['💰Nightly Host Rate for 6 nights'] || null,
    93→    '💰Nightly Host Rate for 7 nights': rawListing['💰Nightly Host Rate for 7 nights'] || null,
    94→    '💰Price Override': rawListing['💰Price Override'] || null,
    95→
    96→    // Keep original schedule field for calculator compatibility
    97→    'Schedule days available': rawListing['Schedule days available'] || [],
    98→    'Minimum Nights': rawListing['Minimum Nights'] || null,
    99→    'Location - Borough': rawListing['Location - Borough'] || null,
   100→
   101→    // Features
   102→    bedrooms: rawListing['Features - Qty Bedrooms'] || null,
   103→    bathrooms: rawListing['Features - Qty Bathrooms'] || null,
   104→    photos: rawListing['Features - Photos'] || [],
   105→    featuredPhotoUrl: rawListing.featuredPhotoUrl || null,
   106→
   107→    // Host reference
   108→    host: {

   110→      verifications: hostData ? countHostVerifications({ host: hostData }) : 0
   111→    },

   115→  };
   116→}
